intro: Eriastrum virgatum, commonly known as silverleaf filaree, is a low-growing annual plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in arid and semi-arid regions.
